item.title: Go Daddy CEO Elephant Debacle
item.description:
GoDaddy, the tech company known for its Super Bowl commercials and accessible domain registration services, has unexpectedly found itself in hot water. CEO Bob Parsons posted a video of himself killing an elephant on a hunting trip, sparking outrage among animal rights activists and everyday people alike. While hunting is a complex issue, the backlash centers around Parsons’ seeming lack of remorse and the blatant celebration of killing an endangered animal...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/go-daddy-ceo-elephant-debacle/

item.title: During the holiday season, Transamerica Life Bermuda and the World Wide Fund for Nature are advocating for the conservation of forests
item.description:
Source: TLB/WWF. A booth for the Rewrap Project. Transamerica Life Bermuda (TLB), a life insurance provider for high-net-worth individuals, has teamed up with the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) in Singapore to launch the Rewrap Project. The campaign, which will run until December 24, 2019, aims to raise awareness about the dangers of deforestation and the importance of forest conservation. All proceeds will support WWF’s conservation initiatives. In 2018 alone, Singapore generated about 1 million tonnes of paper waste...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/during-the-holiday-season-transamerica-life-bermuda-and-the-world-wide-fund-for-nature-are-advocating-for-the-conservation-of-forests/

item.title: The Hilton bans shark fin to align with the changing attitudes towards the Chinese delicacy
item.description:
In February 2014, the Hilton group made an impactful announcement: it would eliminate shark fin from all of its 96 owned and managed properties in Asia Pacific by April 1, 2014. This decision was a significant blow to the waning popularity of the dish, once a staple at Chinese banquets. [Image of shark fin served with scallops and crabmeat] This decision was the culmination of a gradual phase-out. In December 2012, Hilton stopped readily offering shark fin at its managed properties in China and Southeast Asia, making it available only upon request...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-hilton-bans-shark-fin-to-align-with-the-changing-attitudes-towards-the-chinese-delicacy/

item.title: Save Elephants By Transferring Your Domain Names
item.description:
This is a limited-time chance to save money on domain names and support a good cause. Namecheap, a reputable domain and hosting provider, has a special offer today (August 15, 2014). Transfer your .com, .net, or .org domain to Namecheap for just $7.88 for the first year using the code SAVEDUMBO. This is a significantly lower price than most hosting companies. Renewal prices are also competitive. For example, a .com domain renewal costs $10...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/save-elephants-by-transferring-your-domain-names/
